overview: George R. Hendrey is an ESA Certified Senior Ecologist and Distinguished Professor of Earth and Environmental Science at Queens College and The Graduate Center of the City University of New York. He is also Vice President and Chief Technical Officer of COAWAY LLC (COAWAY.com). Prior to moving to Queens College, George was a Tenured Senior Scientist and Head of the Earth Systems Sciences Division at Brookhaven National laboratory. He has authored or co-authored of over 130 peer-reviewed publications, and 150 other contributions to science. His training is in civil engineering and comparative limnology, from which he has taken an engineering perspective into environmental research. George has been engaged in team building for addressing research relating to a variety of global change impacts on both aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems. At COAWAY LLC he has been working on an industrial method for direct extraction of atmospheric CO2, a process that was selected as one of eleven finalists by the Virgin Earth Challenge (VEC).
